'''Prostitution in Uzbekistan''' is illegal but common,<ref name="chartsbin">{{cite web|title=The Legal Status of Prostitution by Country|url=http://chartsbin.com/view/snb|website=ChartsBin|accessdate=31 January 2018}}</ref> especially in [[Samarkand]],<ref name="rise">{{cite news|title= Uzbekistan: Sex Trade on the Rise||work= Institute for War & Peace Reporting|date=|url= http://iwpr.net/report-news/uzbekistan-sex-trade-rise|accessdate=2011-09-18}}</ref> [[Fergana]],<ref name="alliance">{{cite news|title= Uzbekistan: Police and Prostitutes in Unholy Alliance|work= Institute for War & Peace Reporting|date=|url= https://iwpr.net/global-voices/uzbekistan-police-and-prostitutes-unholy|accessdate=2011-09-18}}</ref> and the capital, [[Tashkent]].<ref name="boom">{{cite web|last1=Anjum|first1=Zafar|title=Excerpts: Lusty Indian men for "boom boom" in Uzbekistan|url=https://kitaab.org/2013/11/05/excerpts-lusty-indian-men-for-boom-boom-in-uzbekistan/|website=Kitaab|accessdate=31 January 2018|date=5 November 2013}}</ref> [[Prostitution]] has increased within the country since the [[collapse of the Soviet Union]].<ref name="liberty">{{cite news|title= Central Asia: HIV Infections Mount In Uzbekistan As Prostitution Rises (Part 2)||work= [[Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty]]|date=|url= http://www.rferl.org/content/article/1056145.html|accessdate=2011-09-18}}</ref> [[UNAIDS]] estimate there are 22,000 sex workers in the country.<ref>{{cite web |title=Sex workers: Population size estimate - Number, 2016 |url=http://www.aidsinfoonline.org/gam/stock/shared/dv/PivotData_2018_7_22_636678151733621264.htm |website=www.aidsinfoonline.org |publisher=UNAIDS |accessdate=21 July 2018}}</ref> Many of the women have turned to prostitution in [[Uzbekistan]] because of poverty.<ref name="rise" /><ref name="alliance" />
Law enforcement is inconsistent.<ref name="chartsbin" /> Some police officers will harass prostitutes and extort "protection money" from them.<ref name="chartsbin" /><ref name="alliance" /> Sometimes prostitutes work with police to as informants avoid being arrested.<ref name="alliance" />
The country is a [[sex tourism]] destination for men from [[India]].<ref name="boom" /><ref>{{cite web|title=Travelling with the Indian sex tourist to Tashkent in search of 'full enjoyment'|url=http://www.3quarksdaily.com/3quarksdaily/2014/12/travelling-with-the-indian-sex-tourist-to-tashkent-in-search-of-full-enjoyment.html|website=3 Quarks Daily|accessdate=31 January 2018|date=11 December 2014}}</ref>
==HIV== [[HIV]] is a problem in the country, but the true situation is unknown as the Government has manipulated figure to downplay the problem.<ref name="bearr">{{cite web|title=Uzbekistan: HIV/AIDS Statistics|url=http://www.bearr.org/uzbekistan-hivaids-statistics/|website=The BEARR Trust|accessdate=31 January 2018|date=2012}}</ref> Prostitutes are a high risk group, and has been blamed for a rise in HIV infections.<ref name="liberty" /><ref name="aidsday">{{cite news|title= In-depth: World AIDS Day 2002||work= [[IRIN]]|date=|url= http://www.irinnews.org/InDepthMain.aspx?InDepthId=39&ReportId=70957&Country=Yes|accessdate=2011-09-16 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20081122132842/http://www.irinnews.org/InDepthMain.aspx?InDepthId=39&ReportId=70957&Country=Yes |archive-date=22 November 2008 }}</ref> In 2004, of the reported 11,000 cases of HIV in the country, 20% were sex workers.<ref name="liberty" />
Clients are reluctant to use [[condoms]].<ref name="alliance" /><ref name="liberty" /> UNAIDS estimate 50% condom usage during paid-sex.<ref>{{cite web |title=Condom use among sex workers - Percent, 2016 |url=http://www.aidsinfoonline.org/gam/stock/shared/vc/vcshare.html?id=d78c616e-aabc-4c1e-b4e4-66fce6fab140 |website=www.aidsinfoonline.org |publisher=UNAIDS |accessdate=22 July 2018}}</ref> 95% of Uzbek migrants to [[Russia]] use prostitutes whilst in Russia according to a 2009 survey, sometimes this is unprotected sex. Some get infected with HIV and then pass this on to Uzbek prostitutes on their return.<ref name="bearr" />
2016 estimates of HIV prevalence amongst sex workers is 2.9%<ref>{{cite web |title=HIV prevalence amongst sex workers |url=http://www.aidsinfoonline.org/gam/stock/shared/vc/vcshare.html?id=d9c0ff12-f62c-44e7-8e2c-dbe736bbea30 |website=www.aidsinfoonline.org |publisher=UNAIDS |accessdate=22 July 2018 |date=2016}}</ref>
==Sex trafficking== {{see also|Human trafficking in Uzbekistan}} Uzbekistan is a source and destination country for women and children subjected to sex trafficking. Uzbek women and children are subjected to sex trafficking in the Middle East, Eurasia, and Asia, and also internally in brothels, clubs, and private residences.<ref name="state17">{{cite web|title=Uzbekistan 2017 Trafficking in Persons Report|url=https://www.state.gov/j/tip/rls/tiprpt/countries/2017/271311.htm|website=U.S. Department of State|accessdate=31 January 2018}}{{PD-notice}}</ref>
Article 135 of the criminal code prohibits both sex trafficking and forced labour, prescribing penalties of three to 12 years imprisonment. The government reported that 250 of the crimes investigated in 2016 were related to sexual exploitation.<ref name="state17" />
The [[United States Department of State]] [[Office to Monitor and Combat Trafficking in Persons]] ranks Uzbekistan as a '[[Trafficking in Persons Report#Ranking System|Tier 2 Watch List]]' country.<ref name="state18">{{cite web |title=Uzbekistan 2018 Trafficking in Persons Report |url=https://www.state.gov/j/tip/rls/tiprpt/countries/2018/282778.htm |website=U.S. Department of State |accessdate=1 August 2018}}</ref>
==See also== * [[Prostitution in the Soviet Union]]

{{Orphan|date=March 2017}} {{Infobox model|name=Putri Nony Lovyta|image=DVD3912.jpg|caption=Yukitora Keiji as Marie Rose from Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate|birth_date={{birth date and age|1997|08|12}}|birth_place=[[Bekasi]], Indonesia|nationality=Indonesia|citizenship=Indonesia|ethnicity=|years_active=2004–present (Modeling)
2004–2008 (Acting)
2007–2009 (Singing)
2007–2009 (Dancing)
2009–present (Cosplaying)
2016–present (Illusionist)
2017–present (Fashion Designer)|occupation=[[Cosplay]]er , Fashion Designer|measurements=|height=1.6m|weight=|hair_color=Dark Brown|eye_color=Dark Brown}} '''Alexandria Maria Putri Nony Lovyta,''' also known as '''Yukitora Keiji''' (雪虎慶次, ''ユキトラケイジ''[[Bantuan:Bahasa Jepang|?]]) (born August 12, 1997) is an Indonesian [[cosplay]]er, model, and [[fashion design]]er based in [[Jakarta]]. She is a regular judge at cosplay competitions{{Cite web|url=http://shukenomatsuri.weebly.com/bintang-tamu.html|title=Bintang Tamu|website=Shuken no Matsuri|access-date=2017-03-06}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.explorekebumen.com/2016/09/gojako-day-gombong-japan-korean.html|title=GoJaKo Day - Jangan Lewatkan Event Gombong Japan Korean Day!|work=Explore Kebumen|access-date=2017-03-06}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.bedaunik.com/2016/09/gojako-day-gombong-japan-korean-day.html|title=Gojako Day ( Gombong Japan Korean Day ) Menghadirkan Yukitora Keiji & Rizky Sookyo|work=Beda Unik|access-date=2017-03-06}} and has been featured in various magazines, newspaper and TV shows locally and abroad.{{Cite news|url=http://www.tribunnews.com/lifestyle/2016/06/01/cosplay-yukitora-keiji-cepat-tenar-karena-kebiasaan-meniru-kostum-kostum-komik-ini|title=Cosplay - Yukitora Keiji Cepat Tenar Karena Kebiasaan Meniru Kostum-kostum Komik Ini - Tribunnews.com|work=Tribunnews.com|access-date=2017-03-06|language=id-ID}}{{Cite web|url=http://berita.suaramerdeka.com/smcetak/belajar-bahasa-jepang-secara-otodidak/|title=Belajar Bahasa Jepang secara Otodidak {{!}} suaramerdeka.com|website=berita.suaramerdeka.com|language=id-ID|access-date=2017-03-06}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.radarempoa.com/2016/07/yukitora-keiji-cosplayer-berprestasi-asal-ciputat.html|title=Yukitora Keiji: Cosplayer Cantik Asal Ciputat Tangsel yang Prestasinya Sampai ke Jepang|website=www.radarempoa.com|access-date=2017-03-06}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.gameqq.net/cosplay/11984-lebih-dekat-dengan-yukitora-keiji|title=Lebih Dekat dengan Yukitora Keiji - GameQQ.net|access-date=2017-03-06|language=en-gb}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.lantaitulisan.com/2016/11/cosplay-bukan-sekedar-mengenakan-kostum.html|title=Cosplay, Bukan Sekedar Mengenakan Kostum Unik|website=Lantai Tulisan - Japan Portal|access-date=2017-03-06}} Yukitora was featured on the [[NET.|Net.Tv]] channel's [[:id:Go Show|Go Show]], and become [[Tokyo Game Show]] 2014 Indonesia Cosplay Representative{{Cite news|url=http://www.kotakgame.com/berita/detail/38305/TGS-2014-Secara-Mengejutkan-Jadi-Perwakilan-Indonesia-di-TGS-Yuk-Kenalan-dengan-Yukitora-Keiji|title=[TGS 2014] Secara Mengejutkan Jadi Perwakilan Indonesia di TGS, Yuk Kenalan dengan Yukitora Keiji|last=Fakry|first=Master|date=2014-08-11|work=|access-date=}}{{Cite web|url=http://expo.nikkeibp.co.jp/tgs/2014/en/event/cosplay.html|title=Cosplay Collection Night @TGS {{!}} TOKYO GAME SHOW 2014|website=expo.nikkeibp.co.jp|access-date=2017-03-06}} == Personal life == Putri Nony Lovyta lives in [[Jakarta]], [[Indonesia]], and is fond of art, fashion, video games and comic books. Her mother is the one who give her the nickname ''Yukitora''; "Yuki (雪)" means "Snow" and "Tora (虎)" means "Tiger". Yukitora attended Regina Pacis Elementary School; Tarsisius 2 Junior High School ; Tarsisius 1 High School ; and LPTB Susan Budihardjo, where she graduated year 2017 as a Fashion Designer. Yukitora became involved in entertainment world start from 2004 as a young model and actress, and from 2007 she also joined Purwacaraka Music Studio for vocal courses and Interlude Dance Studio for salsa and belly dance class. == Cosplaying == Yukitora became involved in cosplay after contacting other [[anime]] and [[video game]] enthusiasts. Encouraged by her friends, she started cosplaying in 2009 at the age of 11, joining various competitions in Jakarta. Her first cosplayed character was a Seth Nightroad from [[Trinity Blood]] at Animax Cosplay Competition 2010. She won first place in the WCG Cosplay Competition 2010 Category Anime / Manga as Seth Nightroad from [[Trinity Blood]].{{Cite web|url=http://gamestation.megindo.co.id/event/detail/day_5_wcg_id_national_final_cosplay/|title=DAY 5 WCG ID NATIONAL FINAL: COSPLAY!! {{!}} Event {{!}} Gamestation Magazine Website|website=Gamestation Magazine Website|language=id|access-date=2017-03-06|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304231238/http://gamestation.megindo.co.id/event/detail/day_5_wcg_id_national_final_cosplay/|archivedate=2016-03-04|df=}} being featured on the cover of Issue 170 of ANIMONSTAR a Manga Magazine in the Indonesia.{{Cite web|url=https://animonster.wordpress.com/2013/05/06/telah-terbit-animonstar-170-one-piece/|title=TELAH TERBIT! ANIMONSTAR #170 ONE PIECE!|date=2013-05-06|website=Berita ANIMONSTAR|access-date=2017-03-06}} Since then, she cosplayed a series of characters from over 40 anime, movie and video game titles including: [[Dead or Alive 5 Last Round]], [[Dead or Alive Xtreme 3]], [[K (anime)|K Project]], and [[Sengoku Basara: The Last Party|Sengoku BASARA]], As a multi-awarded cosplayer, she is appearing at conventions and judging competitions locally and abroad. She started judging at the age of 14. === International appearances === After participating in the cosplay community in Indonesia, Yukitora Keiji was invited into various cosplay conventions and events as a participant, performer, judge or to attend as a guest. In November 2014 at [[Makuhari Messe]] in [[Japan]], Yukitora, represented Indonesia as one of the Guest for the [[Tokyo Game Show]] Cosplay Collection Night. Yukitora cosplayed as Empress Sp Gunner Armor from the [[Monster Hunter: Frontier G|Monster Hunter Frontier Generations]] Game. [[File:DVD4436.jpg|left|thumb|254x254px|Yukitora Keiji as Asta]] == Illusionist == Yukitora began performing as an Illusionist on 2016 after encouragement from her teachers Russel Rich, Jiban & Emon and Darius Drew. She performed her first magic show at [[:id:Go Show|Go Show]] [[NET.|Net.Tv]] channel; she was also the winner from Cycle 1. == Endorsements, media and press == Her achievements in the cosplay community led her way to be recognized by the mainstream media and various companies in Indonesia. Currently Became one of the 2017 brand ambassador of a Pop Culture clothing line Jongen, and in 2014 became a brand ambassador for Qeon Interactive latest game Weapons of Mythology.{{Cite web|url=https://klikgame.com/featured/weapons-of-mythology-resmi-jadi-game-ke-5-qeon-interactive|title=Weapons of Mythology Resmi Jadi Game Ke-5 Qeon Interactive {{!}} Klik Game|last=fajar|website=klikgame.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-03-06}}{{Cite web|url=http://gamestation.megindo.co.id/news/detail/qeon_hadirkan_weapons_of_mythology_game_online_kelima_yang_play_2_win|title=Qeon Hadirkan Weapons Of Mythology, Game Online Kelima yang|website=Gamestation Magazine Website|language=id|access-date=2017-03-06}} Past endorsements include many companies such as Qeon Interactive, Istana Boneka, and Buzzbuddies. Yukitora was chosen as Official Cosplayer for [[The Walt Disney Company|Disney]] [[Big Hero 6 (film)|BIG HERO 6]] Hiro Hamada by Istana Boneka, ASTA Online: The War of Tears and Winds from Qeon Interactive, Donita from Unlight, Sasha from Artoncode Vandaria Saga: Winterflame{{Cite web|url=http://www.duniaku.net/2014/08/26/ready-to-jump-into-igs-2014-yukitora-keiji-arrives-as-sasha-from-winterflame/|title=Ready to Jump Into IGS 2014, Yukitora Keiji Arrives as Sasha from Winterflame|last=Urameshi|website=DUNIAKU.NET|access-date=2017-03-06}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.indogamers.com/read/15/08/2014/9747/petualangan_seru_menanti_kita_di_booth_artoncode_dan_vandaria__indonesia_game_show_2014/|title=Petualangan Seru Menanti Kita di Booth Artoncode dan Vandaria Indonesia Game Show 2014|work=www.indogamers.com|access-date=2017-03-06}} and also Queen of Pain from [[Dota 2|Defense of the Ancients 2]] for World of Gaming event by Kairos Event Management. == See also == * [[List of cosplayers]] * [[Cosplay]] == References == {{Reflist|30em}} == External links == {{commons category}} * {{Official website|http://www.yukitorakeiji.com/}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Lovyta, Putri Nony}} [[Category:1997 births]] [[Category:Cosplayers]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Indonesian actresses]] [[Category:Indonesian magicians]] [[Category:Indonesian female models]]

'''Social media use in hiring''' refers to the examination by employers of job applicants' [[social media]] profiles as part of the hiring assessment. Some employers use social media as a tool to screen prospective employees. ==Ethical implications== This issue raises many ethical questions that some consider an employer's right and others consider [[discrimination]]. Except in the states of California, Maryland, and Illinois, there are no laws that prohibit employers from using social media profiles as a basis of whether or not someone should be hired.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.aclu-mn.org/news/2012/03/06/aclu-mn-files-lawsuit-against-minnewaska-area-schools |title=ACLU-MN Files Lawsuit Against Minnewaska Area Schools |website=www.aclu-mn.org |access-date=2016-11-30|date=March 2017 }}</ref> [[Title VII]] also prohibits discrimination during any aspect of employment including hiring or firing, recruitment, or testing.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.aclu.org/other/employers-schools-and-social-networking-privacy |title=Employers, Schools, and Social Networking Privacy |newspaper=American Civil Liberties Union |access-date=2016-11-30}}</ref> Social media has been integrating into the workplace and this has led to conflicts within employees and employers.<sup>[[Social media#cite note-Buettner2015c-107|[107]]]</sup> Particularly, Facebook has been seen as a popular platform for employers to investigate in order to learn more about potential employees. This conflict first started in Maryland when an employer requested and received an employee's Facebook username and password. State lawmakers first introduced legislation in 2012 to prohibit employers from requesting passwords to personal social accounts in order to get a job or to keep a job. This led to Canada, Germany, the U.S. Congress and 11 U.S. states to pass or propose legislation that prevents employers' access to private social accounts of employees.<sup>[[Social media#cite note-108|[108]]]</sup>
Many Western European countries have already implemented laws that restrict the regulation of social media in the workplace. States including Arkansas, California, Colorado, Illinois, Maryland, Michigan, Nevada, New Jersey, New Mexico, Utah, Washington, and Wisconsin have passed legislation that protects potential employees and current employees from employers that demand them to give forth their username or password for a social media account.<ref name="Marche2012">{{cite web |author=Marche, S. |year=2012 |title=Is Facebook Making Us Lonely? |publisher=The Atlantic |accessdate=July 12, 2013 |url=https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2012/05/is-facebook-making-us-lonely/308930/}}</ref> Laws that forbid employers from disciplining an employee based on activity off the job on social media sites have also been put into act in states including California, Colorado, Connecticut, North Dakota, and New York. Several states have similar laws that protect students in colleges and universities from having to grant access to their social media accounts. Eight states have passed the law that prohibits post secondary institutions from demanding social media login information from any prospective or current students and privacy legislation has been introduced or is pending in at least 36 states as of July 2013.<ref>{{cite book |author=Turkle, S. |year=2012 |title=Alone together: Why we expect more from technology and less from each other |location=New York, NY |publisher=Basic Books |isbn=978-0-465-03146-7}}</ref> As of May 2014, legislation has been introduced and is in the process of pending in at least 28 states and has been enacted in Maine and Wisconsin.<ref>{{cite web |first=Elaine |last=Burke for Silicon Republic |date=30 May 2013 |url=http://www.siliconrepublic.com/careers/item/32880-1-in-10-young-people-losing |title=1 in 10 young people losing out on jobs because of pics and comments on social media}}</ref> In addition, the National Labor Relations Board has been devoting a lot of their attention to attacking employer policies regarding social media that can discipline employees who seek to speak and post freely on social media sites.
[[File:Marijuana smoking glass.jpg|thumb|200px|If a young person posts photos on social media of themselves using drugs, this could adversely affect their chance of getting some types of jobs.]]
==Impacts== Use of social media by young people has caused significant problems for some applicants who are active on social media when they try to enter the job market. A survey of 17,000 young people in six countries in 2013 found that 1 in 10 people aged 16 to 34 have been rejected for a job because of online comments they made on social media websites.<ref>{{cite web |first=Elaine |last=Burke for Silicon Republic |date=30 May 2013 |url=http://www.siliconrepublic.com/careers/item/32880-1-in-10-young-people-losing |title=1 in 10 young people losing out on jobs because of pics and comments on social media}}</ref> A 2014 survey of recruiters found that 93% of them check candidates' social media postings.<ref>{{cite web |first=Susie|last= Poppick |date=September 5, 2014 |url=http://time.com/money/3019899/10-facebook-twitter-mistakes-lost-job-snake/ |title=10 Social Media Blunders That Cost a Millennial a Job — or Worse|work=Money Magazine}}</ref> Moreover, professor Stijn Baert of [[Ghent University]] conducted a field experiment in which fictitious job candidates applied for real job vacancies in Belgium. They were identical except in one respect: their Facebook profile photos. It was found that candidates with the most wholesome photos were a lot more likely to receive invitations for job interviews than those with the more controversial photos. In addition, Facebook profile photos had a greater impact on hiring decisions when candidates were highly educated.<ref>{{cite web |last=Baert |first=S. |year=2015 |url=http://ftp.iza.org/dp9584.pdf |title=Do They Find You on Facebook? Facebook Profile Picture and Hiring Chances |id=IZA Discussion Paper No. 9584}}</ref>
These cases have created some [[privacy]] implications as to whether or not companies should have the right to look at employee's Facebook profiles. In March 2012, Facebook decided they might take legal action against employers for gaining access to employee's profiles through their passwords.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://thenextweb.com/socialmedia/2012/03/23/facebook-says-it-may-launch-legal-action-against-employers-who-ask-for-user-passwords/ |title=Facebook May Take Legal Action Over Employer Password Requests |author=Matt Brian |date=23 March 2012 |work=The Next Web}}</ref> According to Facebook Chief Privacy Officer for policy, Erin Egan, the company has worked hard to give its users the tools to control who sees their information. He also said users shouldn't be forced to share private information and communications just to get a job. According to the network's Statement of Rights and Responsibilities, sharing or soliciting a password is a violation of Facebook policy. Employees may still give their password information out to get a job, but according to Erin Egan, Facebook will continue to do their part to protect the privacy and security of their users.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.facebook.com/note.php?note_id=326598317390057 |title=Protecting Your Passwords and Your Privacy |work=facebook.com}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}}

{{About|a sport||Speedball (disambiguation){{!}}Speedball}}
[[Image:Speedball raquette.jpg|thumb]] '''Speed-Ball''' is a [[Racquets (sport)|racquet sport]] invented in [[Egypt]] in [[1961 in sports|1961]] by [[Mohamed Lotfy]] for the training of beginner tennis players. Today it is a sport in its own right, enjoying popularity not only in Egypt but in other countries. Several of these countries make up the International Federation of Speed-Ball (FISB).
== Description == [[Image:Speedball balle.jpg|thumb]] A hollow ball in [[latex]] revolves around a metallic mast (1,70m high) which is linked by a [[nylon]] thread (fishing thread type) of 1,70m length. The thread is knotted to the mast by a loop or a plastic ring freely revolving around a reel. The mast is fixed in a base from 40 kg to 90 kg. The ball is elliptic and is hit with a rigid plastic [[racquet]] with a small handle and a strings around 25 cm of diameter. The speed-ball court is about 6x4 m. for the single match and 8x6 m. for the doubles.
== Rules ==
Speed-ball is played alone (super-solo), with two players (single match), or four players (double match),or four players (relay)
=== Super-solo === [[Image:speedball super-solo.gif|thumb]]
In ''Super-solo'', the aim is to hit the ball a maximum times in one minute. At first with the right hand, then a minute again with the left hand, then with two racquets in fore-hand only, then with two racquets in back-hand only. The number of hits of each movement is added to make the final score of the solo.
The duration of one movement is 30 seconds for the players under 14 years old and one minute for older players. A break of 30 seconds for all classes is granted behind each movement.
The best players can do up to 160 hits in one minute. The current men's world record is 614 hits, set by Egypt's Mohamed Nagy, while the women's record of 539 hits set by Egyptian Noha AbouZeid in the 26th world championship In Kuwait.
=== Single match === [[Image:speedball match simple.gif|thumb]]
The ''single match'' is played by two players, each with one racquet. Each player has their own ground, separated by a neutral strip 60 cm wide (the diameter of the speed-ball's base). A match is divided into games of 10 points. The players attempt to hit the ball once each in turn, inverting its direction of rotation. To score points, the ball must pass twice successively across the opponent's ground, without the opponent being able to return it. If there is a fault, the point is missed and there is a new service. The service is alternated according to who wins each point. The first player to score 10 points wins the game. The first player who wins two games (three games for men's seniors) wins the match.
=== Double match === [[Image:speedball match double.gif|thumb]]
The ''double match'' takes place like the single, in two teams of two players. In each team, the players serve and hit the ball alternatively. The general rules are the same as the single.
Specific mistakes involve the player's rotation and reception of the ball.
== Federation ==
The International Federation of Speed-Ball (FISB) was founded in 1984 by the membership of Egypt, France, and Japan. Several other countries joined the federation ([[Kuwait]], [[KSA]], [[Austria]], [[Slovenia]], [[Denmark]], [[Sudan]], [[India]], [[Lebanon]], [[Nigeria]], [[Afghanistan]], [[UAE]], ...).
== External links == * [http://www.worldspeedball.org The website of the international federation] * [http://www.speed-ball.net The french website] * [http://www.speed-ball.pl The polish website] * [http://www.speedball.jp The official japanese website] * [http://www.speedballusa.com The American website] * [http://www.speedball.jp/rule_english/SpeedBallRules2007aug.pdf The official rules (August 2007)] * [[:fr:speed-ball|This page in French]] * [http://blog.racquetnetwork.com/join/join-racquet-network/ Worldwide Network of Racquet Sports Players -- includes Speedball]
